title: Analysis of rates and a cone

content.question: A container has the shape of an open right circular cone, as shown in the figure above. The height of the container is 10 cm and the diameter of the opening is 10 cm. Water in the container is evaporating so that its depth h is changing at the constant rate of <math> <semantics> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaacq GHsislcaaIZaaabaGaaGymaiaaicdaaaaaaa@3925@</annotation> </semantics> </math> cm/hr. (Note: The volume of a cone of height h and radius r is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40F8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.) (a) Find the volume V of water in the container when h = 5 cm. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: A container has the shape of an open right circular cone, as shown in the figure above. The height of the container is 10 cm and the diameter of the opening is 10 cm. Water in the container is evaporating so that its depth h is changing at the constant rate of <math> <semantics> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaacq GHsislcaaIZaaabaGaaGymaiaaicdaaaaaaa@3925@</annotation> </semantics> </math> cm/hr. (Note: The volume of a cone of height h and radius r is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40F8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.) (a) Find the volume V of water in the container when h = 5 cm. Indicate units of measure.
(b) Find the rate of change of the volume of water in the container, with respect to time, when h = 5 cm. Indicate units of measure.
(c) Show that the rate of change of the volume of water in the container due to evaporation is directly proportional to the exposed surface area of the water. What is the constant of proportionality?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
